title: Hibs storm into last eight
text:
Hibernian 3-1 Hearts: Hibs book Scottish Cup quarter-final tie v Ayr United By Mark Crellin   9:59pm Jason Cummings celebrates after putting Hibs into the lead Hibernian are through to the quarter-finals of the Scottish Cup after beating local rivals Hearts 3-1 in a fifth-round replay at Easter Road on Wednesday. 
The Scottish Championship leaders will next host Ayr United in the last eight, having powered into a 3-0 lead thanks to goals from Jason Cummings, Grant Holt and Andrew Shinnie. 
Esmael Goncalves pulled one back for Hearts with 20 minutes left but it was a disappointing night for the visitors overall, while a second Scottish Cup win in succession remains a possibility for Hibs. 
A crowd of 20,205 packed into Easter Road and the home fans were celebrating after 20 minutes. Cummings shoots Hibs into the lead 
Shinnie started on the bench but came on after just three minutes because of an injury to Chris Humphrey and produced a beautiful pass to split the away defence, allowing the prolific Cummings to slot a shot into the Hearts net. 
Hibs almost doubled their lead but Hearts goalkeeper Jack Hamilton did well to deny John McGinn and Shinnie put the rebound over. 
But the hosts were well on top and added to their advantage moments later, Holt finding the net after Cummings had held the ball up well and then conjured up a clever reverse pass. 
Jamie Walker wasted a Hearts opportunity after the break and the visitors found themselves three-down just after the hour. 
Shinnie let fly from the edge of the box and the previously impressive Hamilton appeared to be at fault as the ball found its way into the net. Grant Holt doubled the Hibernian lead 
The Ladbrokes Premiership side looked beaten but five minutes later were handed a lifeline when referee Steven McLean ruled that Hibs defender Darren McGregor had fouled Goncalves in the box. 
Home keeper Ofir Marciano saved the striker's penalty and then the rebound, but the former St Mirren forward got the break of the ball and forced it over the line at the third attempt. 
The match swung from end to end in the closing stages but there were no further goals, although McGregor nodded a Cummings free-kick into the net, only to see had been flagged offside.
